entry.et: Middle English, from Old English scamu; akin to Old High German scama shame

def.dt: :a painful emotion caused by consciousness of guilt, shortcoming, or impropriety
:the susceptibility to such emotion have you no shame?
:a condition of humiliating disgrace or disrepute :ignominy the shame of being arrested
:something to be regretted :pity it's a shame you can't go
:to bring shame to :disgrace shamed the family name
:to force by causing to feel guilty shamed into confessing
